page.title: 08PARKS AND RECREATION GROUNDS
page.content: There are nine of these in this area. The{Arboretum,}given to Derby by W.Bass contains walks through tree,shrubs and flower-bed lined paths. Clemson's Park,Pear Tree,Rosehill and Stockbrook Street Recreation Grounds are all mainly grass areas where children play and people exercise their pet dogs. King George's{Playing Fields, Normanton Park (the largest of all, occupying about 14 acres), Rowditch and Rykneld Recreation Grounds are grass areas with football pitches, tennis courts, bowling greens and children's play areas with swings and slides. All these places are used mainly by the people who live in their immediate vicinity.
